statements: SELECT * FROM assessments
SELECT assessment_name, total_questions FROM assessments
SELECT * FROM assessments WHERE author_name = 'John Doe'
SELECT assessment_name, creation_date FROM assessments ORDER BY creation_date DESC
SELECT * FROM assessments WHERE total_questions > 10
SELECT * FROM assessments ORDER BY creation_date DESC, assessment_name ASC, author_name DESC;
SELECT assessment_name, total_questions FROM assessments WHERE total_questions > 10 ORDER BY total_questions DESC;
SELECT * FROM assessments WHERE author_name = 'John Doe' AND total_questions < 20 ORDER BY creation_date ASC;
SELECT assessment_name, author_name FROM assessments WHERE total_questions BETWEEN 5 AND 15;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_assessments, SUM(total_questions) AS total_questions_sum FROM assessments;
SELECT * FROM assessments;
SELECT assessment_name, total_questions FROM assessments WHERE time_limit > 60;
SELECT assessment_id, total_questions FROM assessments WHERE assessment_name = 'Math Quiz';
SELECT * FROM quiz_questions ORDER BY question_id DESC;
SELECT question_text, correct_answer FROM quiz_questions WHERE assessment_id = 'abc-123';
SELECT * FROM assessments;
SELECT assessment_name, total_questions FROM assessments WHERE time_limit > 60;
SELECT q.question_text, q.correct_answer, a.assessment_name FROM quiz_questions q INNER JOIN assessments a ON q.assessment_id = a.assessment_id;
SELECT a.assessment_name, COUNT(q.question_id) AS num_questions FROM assessments a LEFT JOIN quiz_questions q ON a.assessment_id = q.assessment_id GROUP BY a.assessment_name;
SELECT * FROM quiz_questions WHERE question_id IN (SELECT question_id FROM quiz_questions ORDER BY RAND() LIMIT 5);
SELECT * FROM online_assessments;
SELECT assessment_name, start_date FROM online_assessments;
SELECT assessment_id, assessment_name FROM online_assessments WHERE assessment_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM quiz_questions ORDER BY question_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM student_responses WHERE assessment_id = 2 AND question_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM online_assessments;
SELECT assessment_id, assessment_name FROM online_assessments WHERE start_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT assessment_name, end_date FROM online_assessments WHERE assessment_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM student_responses ORDER BY assessment_id ASC, question_id DESC;
SELECT student_id, response_text FROM student_responses WHERE assessment_id = 3 AND question_id = 5;
SELECT * FROM assessments;
SELECT assessment_name, assessment_date FROM assessments;
SELECT assessment_name, assessment_date FROM assessments ORDER BY assessment_date DESC;
SELECT question_text, question_type FROM questions;
SELECT * FROM options WHERE question_id = 1;
SELECT assessment_name, assessment_date FROM assessments;
SELECT question_text, question_type FROM questions ORDER BY question_type ASC;
SELECT MAX(assessment_date) AS latest_assessment_date FROM assessments;
SELECT assessment_name, response_date FROM assessments JOIN responses ON assessments.assessment_id = responses.assessment_id ORDER BY response_date DESC;
SELECT assessment_name, COUNT(response_id) AS total_responses FROM assessments LEFT JOIN responses ON assessments.assessment_id = responses.assessment_id GROUP BY assessment_name;
SELECT * FROM assessments;
SELECT assessment_name, assessment_description FROM assessments;
SELECT question_text, question_type FROM questions;
SELECT * FROM choices WHERE is_correct = TRUE;
SELECT response_timestamp, assessment_id FROM responses ORDER BY response_timestamp DESC;
SELECT assessment_name, assessment_description FROM assessments WHERE published_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY assessment_name DESC;
SELECT q.question_text, c.choice_text FROM questions q JOIN choices c ON q.question_id = c.question_id WHERE q.question_type = 'MCQ' AND c.is_correct = TRUE;
SELECT p.participant_name, p.email, r.response_timestamp FROM participants p JOIN responses r ON p.participant_id = r.participant_id ORDER BY r.response_timestamp DESC;
SELECT a.assessment_id, a.assessment_name, COUNT(q.question_id) AS total_questions FROM assessments a LEFT JOIN questions q ON a.assessment_id = q.assessment_id GROUP BY a.assessment_id;

SELECT r.response_id, p.participant_name, a.assessment_name, c.choice_text FROM responses r JOIN participants p ON r.participant_id = p.participant_id JOIN assessments a ON r.assessment_id = a.assessment_id JOIN choices c ON r.response_id = c.choice_id;
